q: leadership. in rio de janeiro, ryan steers, a 23-year-old brazilian documentary film-maker, said Barack Obama can improve the united states' image abroad. " Barack Obama is someone the world can trust," steers said. that is the most important thing for american right now- regaining its trust in the world community. with u.s.-led wars grinding away in iraq and afghanistan, and a financial meltdown shaking the pillars of economies worldwide, many foreigners seemed to associate the George H. "for me it will be a pleasure," milan coach Carlo Ancelotti said. David Beckham is a serious athlete, a great professional. if he'll be available for four months with us, we'll be very happy. Carlo Ancelotti also indicated David Beckham could play for milan in the uefa cup. is made easy in part by mr John McCain 's disappointing campaign, above all his irresponsible selection of a running mate who is not ready to be Barack Obama ," it said. it described the 47-year-old illinois senator as a man of supple intelligence, with a nuanced grasp of complex issues and evident skill at conciliation and consensus-building. the los angeles times also backed Barack Obama in an editorial posted on its web site on friday, saying the democratic nominee answered a need for "a leader who demonstrates thoughtful calm and grace under pressure."
